cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the northern Yucatán today, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast Wednesday and accelerating northeast across the southeastern U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic/Northeast late Thursday–Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Louisiana–Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL (Storm Surge); Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border (Hurricane); Mississippi/Alabama border to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL (Tropical-storm)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico (Hurricane); South of Tulum to Punta Allen and west of Dzilam to Progreso, Mexico (Tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatán Peninsula, entire northern Gulf Coast from TX/LA border eastward to FL Panhandle, then inland across the Southeast U.S. and exiting the Mid-Atlantic coast (including New Jersey and New York Bight)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty 30–40 mph winds possible Friday as system exits coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected (primary surge threat confined to northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday with localized ponding or minor urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated waves in New York Bight could disrupt vessel movements and pilot transfers Friday
